sentences.sContent: "Given the level of competition in law, I definitely think that my postgraduate degree helped to distinguish me from the crowd, " he says.
sentences.sCn: 他说，“考虑到在法律行业的竞争水平，我确实认为我的研究生学位让我从众人中脱颖而出”。

sentences.sContent: Attracted by the greatness of English language, Gu even changed her major from accounting to English in her postgraduate study.
sentences.sCn: 顾秋蓓被英语这门语言的魅力所吸引，她甚至将自己的研究生专业从会计转到了英语专业。

sentences.sContent: ...you can use it not only in the class but also for the postgraduate entrance examination...
...having a passion for my subject is possibly the best reason to go into postgraduate education...
...Specializing at postgraduate level can make you a stronger job applicant...
...but the actual reduction in postgraduate numbers is of real concern as international-students make up the majority of numbers in many postgraduate courses and research teams in science...
...and in particular postgraduate students Who are so important to the UKs research output...
...Attracting the brightest and most ambitious postgraduate and research students is critical if the UK is to maintain its quality reputation for research...

phrases.pCn: 研究生文凭；研究生文凭课程

trans.tranOther: someone who is studying at a university to get a  master’s degree  or a  phd
